intro: Erigeron nudiscapus, commonly known as the naked-stemmed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and prairies. It features a slender, often hairless stem and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
